Starting from 23 January, date in which the next flight from Wuhan to Rome Fiumicino was foreseen, the Italian Ministry of Health put in place a temperature check through scanners and the requirement to fill out a form that shows the destination and the travel route of the passengers once landed.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200731155105/http://www.salute.gov.it/portale/nuovocoronavirus/dettaglioComunicatiNuovoCoronavirus.jsp?lingua=italiano&menu=salastampa&p=comunicatistampa&id=5372
http://www.salute.gov.it/portale/nuovocoronavirus/archivioComunicatiNuovoCoronavirus.jsp?lingua=italiano&area=nuovocoronavirus&comunicati.page=7

Airport checks were increased in the airports of Roma Fiumicino and Milano Malpensa, where flights proceeded as normal.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201103220708/http://www.salute.gov.it/portale/nuovocoronavirus/dettaglioComunicatiNuovoCoronavirus.jsp?lingua=italiano&menu=salastampa&p=comunicatistampa&id=5376

New medical and health personnel was trained to further increase airport checks in Roma Fiumicino and Milano Malpensa with the introduction of a hotline available 24/7.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201103221229/http://www.salute.gov.it/portale/nuovocoronavirus/dettaglioComunicatiNuovoCoronavirus.jsp?lingua=italiano&menu=salastampa&p=comunicatistampa&id=5382

In addition to the health checks already introduced, 4 thermic scanners were installed directly at the arrivals in the airport Roma Fiumicino.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201103221642/http://www.salute.gov.it/portale/nuovocoronavirus/dettaglioComunicatiNuovoCoronavirus.jsp?lingua=italiano&menu=salastampa&p=comunicatistampa&id=5385

On 23 February 2020, the Legislative Degree number 6 provides that in the municipality or the area where at least one person is positive to Covid-19  any individual from that area can move to another area and no one can enter.  School trips are suspended within the national territories and abroad. On 23 February 2020, the Legislative Degree number 6 provides that all the individuals that enter in Italy from countries identified at risk from WTO have to inform to the hospital competent for the area, that would put in place the quarantine, actively monitered. On the First March 2020, the DPCM provides that in Lombardy the following municipalities: Bertonico; Casalpusterlengo; Castelgerundo; Castiglione D'Adda;  Codogno; Fombio; Maleo; San Fiorano; Somaglia; Terranova dei Passerini and in Veneto the following municipality: Vo', individuals cannot go outside their municipality and no one can enter.    Ban on School trip for all educational levels.    See the Official Document: https://web.archive.org/web/20200520020000/https://www.gazzettaufficiale.it/eli/gu/2020/03/01/52/sg/pdf

On the First March 2020, the DPCM provides that in Lombardy in the following municipalities: Bertonico; Casalpusterlengo; Castelgerundo; Castiglione D'Adda;  Codogno; Fombio; Maleo; San Fiorano; Somaglia; Terranova dei Passerini and In Veneto the following municipality: Vo', all the individuals that have entered Italy in the last 14 days from countries considered at risk by WHO have to notify it to the Prevention Department of the territorial health authority and their family doctor.  Then, the public health operator should contact the person and gather as many information as possible, then the quarantine started and the individual is informed regarding symptoms of Covid-19 and the behaviour conduct to implement (quarantine for 14 days, prohibition to move, to meet other people and compulsory to be always recheable ) . During quarantine  the public health operator has to contact the individual daily to be updated on his/her conditions.       See the Official Document: https://web.archive.org/web/20200520020000/https://www.gazzettaufficiale.it/eli/gu/2020/03/01/52/sg/pdf

On the 10 of April, the DPCM establishes all the individuals tested positive to Covid-19 must stay at home, people who suffer from respiratory infection and fever (higher than 37.5) are required to stay at home. More, all people, not only under risk such immunosuppressed, are required to stay at home and avoid crowded places.    People can do sport only outside their house and always at least one meter apart from the others.    See the official document: https://web.archive.org/web/20210920104407/https://www.gazzettaufficiale.it/eli/gu/2020/04/11/97/sg/pdf

On the 10 of April, the DPCM establishes that any individual cannot move from their municipality unless for proven working and health conditions.    School trips are banned.    In the presence of second house property, individuals cannot move there    See the official document: https://web.archive.org/web/20210920104407/https://www.gazzettaufficiale.it/eli/gu/2020/04/11/97/sg/pdf

On the 10 of April, the DPCM establishes that all the individuals that have entered Italy (through aircraft and cruise) in the last 14 days from countries considered at risk by WHO have to notify it to the Prevention Department of the territorial health authority and their family doctor.  Then, the public health operator should contact the person and gather as many information as possible, then the quarantine started and the individual is informed regarding symptoms of Covid-19 and the behaviour conduct to implement (quarantine for 14 days, prohibition to move, to meet other people and compulsory to be always recheable ) . During quarantine  the public health operator has to contact the individual daily to be updated on his/her conditions.   Individuals that cannot quarantine at home have to quarantine for 14 days in a place agreed with the National Department of Civil Protection.     If an individual is positive to Covid-19 in the cruise he/should quarantine in his/her room and ship crew can deliver food and medecine wearing masks.     See the official document: https://web.archive.org/web/20210920104407/https://www.gazzettaufficiale.it/eli/gu/2020/04/11/97/sg/pdf

"on 18th April, the ISS released a guide for the prevention and control of Covid-19 infection within nursing homes, specifying organizational and structural requirements aimed at avoiding catching the virus, managing positive cases and guaranteeing an effective flow of information with Local Health Units and families. Among these, for example, family members and people with symptoms are not allowed to visit for the entire duration of the emergency; new residents can be authorized to move in after being tested for Covid-19 and must be placed in a dedicated area, isolated from other residents. Furthermore, nursing homes are recommended to avoid sending their residents to hospitals for diagnostic tests and medical visits. Group activities and the use of shared spaces are to be suspended; all staff, suppliers and maintenance workers must be properly equipped with PPE. As soon as a resident shows signs of a likely infection s/he must be isolated and tested immediately. If positive, they must be kept in isolation when structurally possible and, otherwise, transferred to an appropriately equipped facility. Special Units for Continuity of Care (for further information please see paragraph 3.2) are responsible for guaranteeing continuous communication with infectious disease specialists and protocols to be followed will be those emitted by the Directorates of each facility. Nursing homes with suspected or ascertained Covid-19 cases (even those awaiting transfer), must provide medical and nursing support 24 hours per day."    http://web.archive.org/web/20210110070649/https://www.covid19healthsystem.org/countries/italy/countrypage.aspx ['Maintaining Essential Services']

Under these provisions, persons traveling to Italy from member states of the European Union, states party to the Schengen Agreement (the non-EU states party to the Schengen Agreement are: Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, and Switzerland), the United Kingdom, Andorra, Monaco, San Marino, and the Vatican City State will no longer be required to self-isolate under the supervision of health authorities for 14 days unless they have stayed in other countries during the 14-day period prior to entering Italy. For those traveling from a country not listed above, including the United States, travel to Italy will be allowed only for proven work, urgent health needs, or to return to your place of residence. Following the Parliament’s approval for a further €25 billion (1.6 percent of GDP) deficit deviation, on August 8, the government adopted a new third support package. Labor and social measures (€12 billion) include, among other things, additional income support for families and some workers, an extension of the short-time work program, and a suspension of social security contribution for new hires. Other key measures are extensions of the moratorium on SMEs’ debt repayment and the time to pay back tax obligations.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200924201030/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

On August 16, the first human trial of Italy's potential coronavirus vaccine began, after thousands of people applied to test the vaccine. The vaccine was administered to the first patient and will gradually be administered to more volunteers, up to 45 healthy people aged 18 to 55 in this first phase. No change in policy found.    COVID-19 testing procedures in Italy vary by region, and individuals should consult regional health authorities for further guidance. Generally, the first step is a blood test (serological test) to identify the presence of antibodies that are found in the blood following contact with the virus. To carry out this test, it is necessary to go to an authorized public or private laboratory with a prescription from a physician. This test costs approximately 15 Euro and is paid for by the individual being tested. In the event of a positive response to the blood test, a nasal swab test (oropharyngeal test) should be promptly carried out to determine if the infection is active or if there is risk of transmitted it to others. The nasal swab test is coordinated by the Italian National Health System (SSN) at no charge to the person tested.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201013215656/https://it.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

"The Ministry of Health has the task of tracing all the close contacts of a Covid-19 case present on a means of transport (air, train, ferry), collecting the data and transmitting them to the Regions, to activate the quarantine measure.    Contact tracing-(CT) consists in making a timely and accurate search of all persons (close contacts) who may have been exposed to the COVID-19 case during the period of infection, and who could in turn develop the infection, become contagious and thus fuel the transmission. The CT is a key public health tool to break the transmission chains of Covid-19 cases."    "Immuni is an app that helps us fight epidemics—starting with COVID-19:    the app aims to notify users at risk of carrying the virus as early as possible—even when they are asymptomatic  these users can then self-isolate to avoid infecting others. This minimises the spread of the virus, while speeding up a return to normal life for most people  by being alerted early, these users can also contact their general practitioner promptly and lower the risk of serious consequences.  All the relevant information about the functioning of the system is available on the:    http://immuni.italia.it/">immuni.italia.it website"    http://web.archive.org/web/20210116182851/http://www.salute.gov.it/portale/nuovocoronavirus/dettaglioFaqNuovoCoronavirus.jsp?lingua=english&id=230

From March 30th additional restrictions are enforced for those who travel abroad. Italians travelling abroad will now need to take an antigen test 48 hours prior to departure (when they are coming back to Italy), and the test will have to be negative in order to be able to travel back to Italy. ***Recoded - Red zones in Sicily announced until June 3. Ban on events.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210525105342/https://www.lasicilia.it/news/covid/419108/covid-in-sicilia-istituita-nuova-zona-rossa-e-un-altra-revocata.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20210528172054/https://palermo.repubblica.it/cronaca/2021/05/27/news/covid_in_sicilia_due_nuove_zone_rosse_a_geraci_siculo_e_lercara_friddi-303053482/    In every zone (be it Yellow or White) there are restrictions for events: limited number of participants and distancing measures, in white zones masks still need to be worn and for events (such as parties) participants will require a green pass  https://web.archive.org/web/20210601170855/https://www.ilsole24ore.com/art/zona-bianca-domande-e-risposte-cosa-si-puo-fare-salta-coprifuoco-resta-l-obbligo-mascherina-AE6qYaM    Note that events are allowed based on adherance to specified guidance. Green passes are in use for events; however, it is possible for events to happen without green passes (e.g. through assigned seating, capacity restrictions, etc.) and there is not a national mandate on green passes for events, so coded as 1G. See:     "The activities must be carried out in compliance with the guidelines adopted by the regions or by the Conference of Regions and autonomous provinces or, failing that, in compliance with the national ones. In relation to the progress of the epidemiological situation and the characteristics of the sites and outdoor events, a different maximum number of spectators can be established, in compliance with the principles established by the Technical-Scientific Committee, with suitable guidelines to prevent or reduce the risk of contagion adopted by the Conference of Regions and Autonomous Provinces. These guidelines may provide, with reference to particular events, that access is reserved only for subjects in possession of COVID-19 green certifications."     https://web.archive.org/web/20210604071153/https://www.governo.it/it/articolo/domande-frequenti-sulle-misure-adottate-dal-governo/15638#zone

The government approved a new decree (DL 6 August 2021 n. 111) containing "Urgent measure for the secure exercise of school, university, social activities and transportation". The decree states for the school year 2021/22 lessons will be in presence from kindergarten to high school, and unless not possible for university. However, social distancing and containment measures remain: pupils (ages 6+) and teachers are required to wear masks, a distance of at least 1 metre is recommended, and entrance to school facilities and buildings is prohibited for those exhibiting respiratory or flu-like symptoms or with a temperature of 37.5 degrees and above. All school personnel has to be in possession of a COVID green pass (EU digital COVID certificate). The pass can be obtained by completing the COVID-19 vaccination cycle, being in possession of a negative molecular or antigen test taken within 48 hours, being in possession of a certificate of recovery from COVID-19 dated within six months. In case of a positive COVID-19 test in a classroom, individual regions/school district officials can decide to forgo normal containment measures in case the entire class is vaccinated. In person schooling can be stopped by region presidents if their region is in a red/orange zone and/or there is an extremely high risk of contagion. Source: http://archive.today/ayxMd | http://archive.today/GyyAg

Events are allowed with conditions. Social distancing and mask wearing (indoors) are compulsory. Venues can operate at a maximum of 50% capacity outdoors and 25% indoors for sports events. Other venues have to abide by the same rules when the number of spectators is above 5.000 (outdoors) and 2.500 (indoors). To attend weddings, religious and cultural events a green pass is needed. From August 6th the green pass will also be necessary to access all other indoor venues. Source: http://archive.today/aiGia | http://archive.today/7ICsB

Even in "white zones" large gatherings ("assembramenti") are not allowed. Venues can operate at a maximum of 50% capacity outdoors and 25% indoors for sports events. Other venues have to abide by the same rules when the number of spectators is above 5.000 (outdoors) and 2.500 (indoors). To attend weddings, religious and cultural events a green pass is needed. From August 6th the green pass will also be necessary to access all other indoor venues. Source: http://archive.today/aiGia | http://archive.today/7ICsB
Public transport is open with the requirements of social distancing and mask wearing. Source: http://archive.today/aiGia | http://archive.today/7ICsB
As long as all regions in Italy are a "white zone", stay at home requirements are not in place. Source: http://archive.today/aiGia | http://archive.today/7ICsB

Although internal movement is allowed for those travelling for family or work reasons, or in possession of a green pass while all of Italy remains a "white zone", those subject to quarantine or with a temperature of 37,5 degrees and above are not allowed to travel. Social distancing and mask wearing are required when travelling. http://archive.today/aiGia | http://archive.today/7ICsB

Travel from Brazil, Sri Lanka, India and Bangladesh are prohibited until August 30th 2021. Travelling from other countries is allowed but subject to one or more of the following conditions: 1) compiling the Passenger Locator form; 2) being in possession of a vaccine passport; 3) being in possession of a negative molecular or antigen test taken within 48 hours before travel; 4) fiduciary self-isolation between 5 and 10 days. Source: http://archive.today/T9FLJ

In addition to the DL 30 June 2021 n. 99, The EU has approved art. 43 of DL 73/2021 that exempts from labour taxes the tourism, thermae, commerce sectors, as well as creative-cultural and entertainment sectors.
